quest.name: In the Company of Heroes
journal: Y'shtola is concerned for your well-being.

In a wholly unexpected turn of events, Wheiskaet reveals that the banquet preparations were but an excuse for his comrades to evaluate your worthiness to face Titan. The other former members of the Company of Heroes are also in attendance, and the five warriors all agree that you have the necessary qualities to defeat the Lord of Crags. Their assessment now formally concluded, Wheiskaet decrees that all present should enjoy the festivities. Be sure to thank the bronze-skinned beauty for the dazzling performance being given by her troupe.
After congratulating you on your accomplishments, the troupe leader encourages you to partake of the feast with the other guests.
It would seem Dyrstweitz's reputation as a culinarian is well founded, as the feast exceeds all expectation. Having sated your hunger, converse with the former members of the Company of Heroes.

You listen carefully to the parting words of each former mercenary, and accord them due respect. All present seem to have enjoyed themselves immensely, save perhaps for Y'shtola who seems loath to carouse with the other guests. Maybe you should inquire as to the cause of her reticence.

Y'shtola observes that the festivities were as much for the benefit of the Company of Heroes as they were for you. Nevertheless, you have satisfied Wheiskaet's conditions, and may now ask him how to reach Titan's lair.
objectives: Speak with the former members of the Company of Heroes.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To accept this quest, you must abandon the current main scenario quest. Open the corresponding entry in the journal or duty list and select “Abandon.”

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...You have the look of a womanman who has been to the seventh hell and back.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That a guest should be expected to supply the victuals for a banquet held in herhis own honor... And this while the shadow of Titan looms over us all! It beggars belief.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I can only applaud your stoicism. Had I been asked to endure such ignominy, I fear I should have accepted my lot with less grace.

dialogue.name: GEGERUJU
dialogue.text: Lady Y'shtola! LadySir Surname!

dialogue.name: GEGERUJU
dialogue.text: A thousand pardons for this extreme discourtesy! I was wholly unaware of your true identity, madamsir! Had I known, I would never have permitted my man to subject you to such unspeakable ordeals!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: (-???-)Come now, shehe must have sensed something was amiss.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: You didn't seriously think I would send you running the length and breadth of Eorzea for a banquet, did you?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Spare herhim your mockery, Captain. Your intent was unclear to me until this moment. And unlike me, Forename has no knowledge of your traditions. Mayhap you would be so good as to enlighten herhim.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Aye, aye...fair's fair. There's no sense hiding it any longer.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: We five were chosen by our brothers and sisters, and before the Company of Heroes disbanded, we each swore a solemn oath...

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: That any who would follow in our footsteps must be weighed and measured─not by their reputation, but by their deeds.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Each man would judge these would-be god-slayers by his own criteria. If even one found herhim wanting, shehe would be rejected without a second thought.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: But if shehe proved herselfhimself worthy, we swore that we would do our utmost to support herhis cause.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: The world has ever been full of brave souls eager to give their lives for a righteous cause, but all too few capable of making a difference with their sacrifice. To send wave after wave of hapless adventurers into the jaws of a foe against whom they have no hope of victory is worse than futile. Titan is not one to be challenged lightly, and we will not be complicit in the deaths of the unworthy.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Which is why the five of you deigned to test Forename with such commendable thoroughness. Time well spent, I am sure. But tell us, Captain: what is the assessment of you and your fellows?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: SheHe's a brave one, that much is certain. SheHe willingly walked into the midst of danger, despite my repeated warnings that it could cost her herhim his life.

dialogue.name: UODHNUN
dialogue.text: HerHis skill is undeniable. SheHe stalked herhis prrrey as relentlessly as any child of the sands, and struck with precision when an opportunity presented itself.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: Too many adventurers these days care only for fortune and glory. Forename, however, is a kind and generous soul. I am certain shehe has no shortage of loyal allies who will gladly fight at herhis side.

dialogue.name: BRAYFLOX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Wily uplander is talentful plansmaker. Tricksy foe for mighty rockman!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: I can only concur with my colleagues' assessments.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: We five of the Company of Heroes hereby judge you a worthy challenger. Cast down the Lord of Crags, Forename Surname, and write a new chapter in the history of Eorzea.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: With the formalities out of the way, let the festivities begin! Summon the dancers, pour the wine!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Eat, drink, and be merry, my friends, for today we celebrate the birth of a new legend─Forename Surname, Titan's Bane!

dialogue.name: COMPANYOFHEROES
dialogue.text: (-Company of Heroes-)Forename Surname, Titan's Bane!

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Seeing everyone again like this brings back such fond memories. Hmmm...I wonder if any of them would be interested in reforming the Company?

dialogue.name: UODHNUN
dialogue.text: It has been too long since I last set foot outside Forgotten Springs. Passing the time with old frrriends and old wine... Aye, today is a good day indeed.

dialogue.name: BRAYFLOX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Tastyfresh treats are plentiful in belly of Brayflox!

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: It feels wonderful to be with the others again. I wish this day would never end...

dialogue.name: NPC
dialogue.text: (Your Elezen friend is quite the dashing rogue. Any chance you could introduce me?)

dialogue.name: NPC
dialogue.text: Congratulations, sweetling! Now relax and enjoy the show─it's only just begun!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Tasting the exotic feast triggers a divine revelation. In that brief, transcendent moment, you glimpse the true form of reality, comprehend its fleeting nature, and cry out to the heavens in celebration.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: You are blessed with a fortitude to rival the earth itself. Titan will struggle to break you, I think.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, you brave fool! Promise me that when you meet Titan, you'll look him in the eye and tell him Landenel sends his regards!

dialogue.name: UODHNUN
dialogue.text: You are a veteran of countless battles, Forename. This is but one more. Trrrust in your experience, and you will prevail.

dialogue.name: BRAYFLOX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Goodly uplander must be facing mighty rockman with clever fighty-think. Gobbieflock cannot be coming to rescue this time!

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: When you face the Lord of Crags, think not of Limsa Lominsa, Eorzea, or anything beyond his chamber. Think only of the men and women by your side.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: Fight for them, and they will fight for you. Remember that no great victory was ever achieved alone.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...You are kind to indulge them, Forename. This banquet is as much for the Company as it is for you, whatever they may claim.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I do not deny that they mean well, but now is scarcely the time for celebration. Though they have all but pronounced you the victor, the battle with Titan has yet to begin. The hour has come for the good captain to make good on his promise. We must speak with him again.

obj.n: It Was a Very Good Year
